ri:Resource.title: SDSS Data Release 7 (DR7)

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: Stars,Survey,Galaxy
content.description: This is an AstroGrid Dataset Access installation of the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) DR7 hosted by the Wide Field Astronomy Unit (WFAU), University of Edinburgh. WFAU would like to thank John Hopkins University and the University of Chicago for permission to host the data.

capability.description: Access to two applications: general ADQL query, and asynchronous cone-search where relevant/enabled.

table.name: SpecObjAll
table.description: Contains the measured parameters for a spectrum

column.name: cx
column.description: x of Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: cy
column.description: y of Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: cz
column.description: z of Normal unit vector in J2000

column.name: primTarget
column.description: Specifies which primary target catagories the object was selected in.

column.name: secTarget
column.description: Specifies which secondary target catagories the object was selected in.

column.name: seguePrimTarget
column.description: Specifies which SEGUE primary target catagories the object was selected in.

column.name: segueSecTarget
column.description: Specifies which SEGUE secondary target catagories the object was selected in.

column.name: otherPrimTarget
column.description: Specifies which other program primary target catagories the object was selected in.

column.name: otherSecTarget

column.description: Deemed to be science-worthy (defines default view SpecObj)

column.name: plateID
column.description: Link to plate on which the spectrum was taken

column.name: throughput
column.description: fiber throughput as measured by mapper

column.name: delta
column.description: Distance between this object and the nearest matching USNO-B object.

column.name: match
column.description: Number of objects in USNO-B which matched this object within a 1 arcsec radius. If negative, then the nearest matching USNO-B object itself matched more than 1 SDSS object.

column.description: Error in proper motion in right ascension.

column.name: pmDecErr

column.description: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in r.a.

column.name: sigDec
column.description: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in dec.

column.name: nFit
column.description: Number of detections used in the fit including the SDSS detection (thus, the number of plates the object was detected on in USNO-B plus one).

column.description: Recalibrated USNO-B O magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS g

column.description: Recalibrated USNO-B E magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS r

column.name: F

table.name: RC3
table.description: The main PhotoObj table for the RC3 catalo

column.name: good_position
column.description: The values of ra/dec are good to 0.1 sec time, 1 asec (otherwise, 0.1 min time, 1 amin)

column.name: galactic_l
column.description: Galactic longitude in the IAU 1958 system (Blaauw et al. 1960); good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: galactic_b
column.description: Galactic latitude in the IAU 1958 system (Blaauw et al. 1960); good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: superGalactic_l
column.description: Supergalactic longitude in the RC2 system; good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: superGalactic_b
column.description: Supergalactic latitude in the RC2 system; good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: PosAngle
column.description: position angle, measured in degrees from north through east (all p.a. < 180 degrees), taken when available from UGC, ESO, and ESGC (and in a few cases from HI data).

column.name: rc2_type
column.description: mean revised morphological type in the RC2 system, coded as in RC2

column.name: rc2_typeSource
column.description: Sources of revised morphological type estimate

column.name: T_type
column.description: Mean numerical index of stage along the Hubble sequence in the RC2 system

column.name: LC_rc2
column.description: Mean numerical luminosity class in the RC2 system

column.name: B_T
column.description: Total (asymptotic) magnitude in the B system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric aperture-magnitude data, B_T^A, and from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point, B_T^S

column.name: B_Tsource
column.description: M when B_T is the weighted mean of B_T^A and B_T^S; V when B_T is a V-band magnitude rather than a B-band magnitude; v when the nucleus of the galaxy is variable; * when deriving B_T^A would have required an extrapolation in excess of 0.75 mag.

column.name: B_T0
column.description: total ``face-on'' magnitude corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: M_B
column.description: Photographic magnitude from Ames (1930), Shapley and Ames (1932), CGCG, Buta and Corwin (1986), and/or Lauberts and Valentijn (1989) reduced to the B_T system

column.name: M_FIR
column.description: Far-infrared magnitude calculated from M_FIR = - 20.0 - 2.5 log_10(FIR), where FIR is the far infrared continuum flux measured at 60 and 100 microns as listed in the IRAS Point Source Catalog (1987). For galaxies larger than 8 arcmin in RC2 and for the Virgo cluster area, resolved by the IRAS beam, integrated fluxes are taken from Rice et al. (1988) or Helou et al. (1988)

column.name: M_21cm
column.description: 21-cm emission line magnitude, and its mean error, defined by m_21 = 21.6 - 2.5 log(S_H), where S_H is the measured neutral hydrogen flux density in units of 10^-24 W/m^2

column.name: BV_T
column.description: Total (asymptotic) color index in the Johnson B-V system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric color-aperture data, and/or from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point

column.name: BV_T0
column.description: Total B-V color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: BV_e
column.description: Mean B-V color index within the effective aperture A_e, derived by interpolation from photoelectric color-aperture data

column.name: UB_T
column.description: Total (asymptotic) color index in the Johnson U-B system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric color-aperture data, and/or from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point

column.name: UB_T0
column.description: Total U-B color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: UB_e
column.description: Mean U-B color index, and its mean error, within the effective aperture A_e, derived by interpolation from photoelectric color-aperture data

column.name: lgD_25
column.description: mean decimal logarithm of the apparent major isophotal diameter measured at or reduced to surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: lgD_0
column.description: decimal logarithm of the isophotal major diameter corrected to ``face-on'' (inclination = 0 degrees), and corrected for Galactic extinction to A_g = 0, but not for redshift

column.name: lgR_25
column.description: Mean decimal logarithm of the ratio of the major isophotal diameter, D_25, to the minor isophotal diameter, d_25, measured at or reduced to the surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: logA_e
column.description: Decimal logarithm of the apparent diameter (in 0.1 arcmin) of the ``effective aperture,'' the circle centered on the nucleus within which one-half of the total B-band flux is emitted

column.name: m_e
column.description: mean B-band surface brightness in magnitudes per square arcmin (B-mag/arcmin^2) within the effective aperture A_e, as given by the relation m'_e = B_T + 0.75 + 5logA_e - 5.26. m'_e is statistically related to the effective mean surface brightness, mu'_e (RC2, p. 31; Olson and de Vaucouleurs 1981), with which it coincides when log R = 0 (i = 0 degrees)

column.name: m_25
column.description: m'_25 = the mean surface brightness in B-mag/arcmin^2 within the mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2 elliptical isophote of major axis D_25 and axis ratio R_25, defined as in RC2 (Equation 21) by: m'_25 = B_T + Delta m_25 + 5 logD_25 - 2.5 logR_25 - - 5.26, where Delta m_25 = 2.5 log(L_T/L_D_25) = B_25 - B_T is the magnitude increment contributed by the outer regions of a galaxy fainter than mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: A_B
column.description: Galactic extinction in B-band magnitudes, calculated following Burstein and Heiles (1978a,b, 1982, 1984)

column.name: A_HI_self
column.description: HI line self-absorption in magnitudes (for correction to face-on), calculated from logR and T >= 1

column.name: A_B_int
column.description: internal extinction in B-band magnitudes (for correction to face-on), calculated from logR and T

column.name: W_20
column.description: Neutral hydrogen line full width measured at the 20% level (I_20/I_max)

column.name: W_50
column.description: Neutral hydrogen line full width measured at the 50% level (I_50/I_max)

column.name: HI
column.description: corrected neutral hydrogen index, which is the difference m_21^0 - B_T^0 between the corrected (face-on) 21-cm emission line magnitude and the similarly corrected magnitude in the B_T system. N.n. Since m_21 and B_T are provided in this table, there is no need to list the uncorrected index.

column.name: V_21cm
column.description: Mean heliocentric radial velocity, and its mean error, in km/s derived from neutral hydrogen observations

column.name: V_opt
column.description: mean heliocentric radial velocity, and its mean error, in km/s derived from optical observations

column.name: V_GSR
column.description: weighted mean of the neutral hydrogen and optical velocities, corrected to the ``Galactic standard of rest

column.name: V_3K
column.description: weighted mean velocity corrected to the reference frame defined by the 3 K microwave background radiation

column.name: htmID
column.description: 20-deep hierarchical trangular mesh ID of this object

column.name: rSigma2
column.description: Stddev of r-band mag difference (spectro - photo)

column.name: xygrSig1

column.name: xygrSig2
column.description: Sigma of (g-r) offsets as a fcn of plate x/y
